activeMqSource.description: Subscribes to ActiveMQ topics and queues

items.description: List of items for the connector

examples.name: activeMqBroker1
examples.init_script:
-- Initialize JSON library for message parsing
json = require('json')
stringx = require('pl.stringx')
print('ActiveMQ connector initialized')
examples.enter_script:
-- Log each polling cycle
-- print('ActiveMQ polling cycle started')

items.name: ProductionEvents
items.script:
-- Parse JSON message and extract event type
local data = json.decode(result)
return data.eventType or 'Unknown'

items.name: MachineAlerts
items.script:
-- Parse alert message and format for downstream
local alert = json.decode(result)
local severity = alert.severity or 'INFO'
local message = alert.message or 'No message'
return severity .. ': ' .. message

items.name: QualityReports
items.script:
-- Extract quality metrics
local report = json.decode(result)
if report.passRate then
  return tonumber(report.passRate)
else
  return nil
end

items.name: SystemHeartbeat
OrderUpdates
items.script:
-- Process order status updates
local order = json.decode(result)
if order.status and order.orderId then
  emit('./OrderStatus_' .. order.orderId, order.status)
  return order.orderId .. ': ' .. order.status
end
return nil

items.name: TemperatureSensors
items.script:
-- Parse temperature data
local sensor = json.decode(result)
if sensor.value and sensor.sensorId then
  -- Emit individual sensor readings
  emit('./Temp_' .. sensor.sensorId, tonumber(sensor.value))
  -- Return averaged value for this item
  return tonumber(sensor.value)
end
return nil

items.name: ProductionCommands
items.script:
-- Process production commands
local cmd = json.decode(result)
if cmd.command == 'START' then
  return 'Production Started'
elseif cmd.command == 'STOP' then
  return 'Production Stopped'
elseif cmd.command == 'PAUSE' then
  return 'Production Paused'
else
  return 'Unknown Command: ' .. (cmd.command or 'None')
end

items.name: InventoryUpdates
items.script:
-- Track inventory levels
local inv = json.decode(result)
if inv.partNumber and inv.quantity then
  -- Emit individual part quantities
  emit('./Inventory_' .. inv.partNumber, tonumber(inv.quantity))
  -- Return summary for this item
  return inv.partNumber .. ': ' .. inv.quantity
end
return nil

items.name: ErrorLogs
items.script:
-- Process error messages
local error = json.decode(result)
local timestamp = error.timestamp or os.date('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')
local severity = error.level or 'ERROR'
local message = error.message or 'Unknown error'
return timestamp .. ' [' .. severity .. '] ' .. message

items.name: WildcardMonitor
items.script:
-- Monitor all factory topics (wildcard)
-- Log message source and basic info
local data = json.decode(result)
local source = data.source or 'Unknown'
print('Received message from: ' .. source)
return 'Message from ' .. source

examples.name: autoclave1
examples.init_script:
-- Initialize autoclave monitoring
print('ASC CPC Autoclave connector initialized')
-- Define alarm state mappings
AlarmStates = {
  [0] = 'Normal',
  [1] = 'Warning', 
  [2] = 'Fault'
}
examples.enter_script:
-- Check system time for cycle tracking
currentTime = os.time()
examples.exit_script:
-- Log completion of data collection cycle
-- print('Autoclave data collection completed')

items.name: Availability
items.script:
-- Calculate availability based on connection status
local isConnected = cache('./$SYSTEM/IsConnected', false)
return isConnected and 'Available' or 'Unavailable'

items.name: Temperature
items.script:
-- Convert temperature and validate range
local temp = tonumber(result)
if temp and temp > -50 and temp < 500 then
  return math.floor(temp * 10) / 10
else
  return nil
end

items.name: Pressure
items.script:
-- Process pressure reading
local pressure = tonumber(result)
if pressure and pressure >= 0 and pressure <= 100 then
  return math.floor(pressure * 100) / 100
else
  return nil
end

items.name: PumpHours
items.script:
-- Track pump operating hours
local hours = tonumber(result)
if hours and hours >= 0 then
  return math.floor(hours * 100) / 100
else
  return 0
end

items.name: UserOperator
items.script:
-- Clean operator name
local operator = tostring(result or '')
operator = string.gsub(operator, '^%s*(.-)%s*$', '%1') -- trim whitespace
return operator ~= '' and operator or 'Unknown'

items.name: Program
items.script:
-- Process current recipe/program
local program = tostring(result or '')
program = string.gsub(program, '^%s*(.-)%s*$', '%1')
return program ~= '' and program or 'No Program'

items.name: CycleTime
items.script:
-- Convert cycle time to minutes
local timeSeconds = tonumber(result)
if timeSeconds and timeSeconds > 0 then
  return math.floor(timeSeconds / 60 * 10) / 10 -- minutes with 1 decimal
else
  return 0
end

items.name: VacuumLevel
items.script:
-- Process vacuum level
local vacuum = tonumber(result)
if vacuum and vacuum >= 0 and vacuum <= 30 then
  return math.floor(vacuum * 100) / 100
else
  return nil
end

items.name: ControlPowerConditionTriggered
items.script:
-- Store control power condition in cache
set('cptrig', result)
return nil -- Don't emit this directly

items.name: ControlPowerAlarmActive
items.script:
-- Store control power alarm status in cache
set('cpalm', result)
return nil -- Don't emit this directly

items.name: ControlPowerCondition
items.script:
-- Combine control power status
local cptrig = cache('cptrig', false)
local cpalm = cache('cpalm', false)
if cpalm then
  return 'Fault'
elseif cptrig then
  return 'Warning'
else
  return 'Normal'
end

items.name: DoorStatus
items.script:
-- Process door status
local doorOpen = result
if doorOpen == true or doorOpen == 1 then
  return 'Open'
else
  return 'Closed'
end

items.name: HeaterStatus
items.script:
-- Process heater status
local heaterOn = result
if heaterOn == true or heaterOn == 1 then
  return 'On'
else
  return 'Off'
end

items.name: CycleState
items.script:
-- Map cycle state numbers to text
local state = tonumber(result)
local states = {
  [0] = 'Idle',
  [1] = 'Running',
  [2] = 'Paused',
  [3] = 'Complete',
  [4] = 'Fault',
  [5] = 'Aborting'
}
return states[state] or 'Unknown'

items.name: AlarmCount
items.script:
-- Track total active alarms
local count = tonumber(result)
return count and count >= 0 and count or 0

items.name: ProcessPhase
items.script:
-- Current process phase
local phase = tostring(result or '')
phase = string.gsub(phase, '^%s*(.-)%s*$', '%1')
return phase ~= '' and phase or 'No Phase'

fanucRobotSource.description: Reads R-J3iB, R-30iA, R-30iB Fanuc Robot controllers using SNPX

items.description: List of items for the connector

examples.name: fanucRobot1
examples.init_script:
-- Initialize Fanuc Robot monitoring
print('Fanuc Robot connector initialized')
-- Define robot status mappings
RobotStates = {
  [0] = 'Stopped',
  [1] = 'Running',
  [2] = 'Paused',
  [3] = 'Error',
  [4] = 'Emergency_Stop'
}
-- Position conversion factors
MM_TO_INCHES = 0.0393701
examples.enter_script:
-- Log robot monitoring cycle
-- print('Robot data collection cycle started')
examples.exit_script:
-- Calculate robot utilization
local isRunning = cache('./RobotRunning', false)
local currentTime = os.time()
local lastTime = cache('last_util_time', currentTime)
local runTime = cache('total_run_time', 0)
if isRunning and currentTime > lastTime then
  runTime = runTime + (currentTime - lastTime)
  set('total_run_time', runTime)
end
set('last_util_time', currentTime)
-- Calculate utilization percentage over last hour
local utilization = (runTime / 3600) * 100
if utilization <= 100 then
  emit('./Utilization', math.floor(utilization * 10) / 10)
end

examples.name: haasVf2
examples.init_script:
-- Initialize Haas SHDR processing
print('Haas SHDR connector initialized')
-- Define execution state mappings
ExecutionStates = {
  ['IDLE'] = 'Idle',
  ['ACTIVE'] = 'Active',
  ['INTERRUPTED'] = 'Interrupted',
  ['FEED_HOLD'] = 'Feed_Hold',
  ['STOPPED'] = 'Stopped'
}
-- Define controller mode mappings
ControllerModes = {
  ['AUTOMATIC'] = 'Automatic',
  ['MANUAL'] = 'Manual',
  ['MDI'] = 'Manual_Data_Input',
  ['JOG'] = 'Jog',
  ['REFERENCE'] = 'Reference'
}
examples.enter_script:
-- Log SHDR data collection cycle
-- print('Haas SHDR data collection started')
examples.exit_script:
-- Calculate spindle utilization
local spindleLoad = cache('./SpindleLoad', 0)
local maxLoad = 100
if spindleLoad > 0 then
  local utilization = (spindleLoad / maxLoad) * 100
  emit('./SpindleUtilization', math.floor(utilization * 10) / 10)
end

items.name: Availability
items.script:
-- Calculate machine availability
local isConnected = cache('./$SYSTEM/IsConnected', false)
local hasAlarm = cache('./EmergencyStop', 'NORMAL') ~= 'NORMAL'
if not isConnected then
  return 'Unavailable'
elseif hasAlarm then
  return 'Fault'
else
  return 'Available'
end

items.name: Execution

return ExecutionStates[state] or state

return program ~= '' and program or 'No_Program'

items.name: MCode
items.script:
-- Current M-code
local mcode = tonumber(result)
if mcode and mcode >= 0 and mcode <= 999 then
  return 'M' .. string.format('%02d', mcode)
else
  return 'No_MCode'
end

items.name: GCode
items.script:
-- Current G-code
local gcode = tonumber(result)
if gcode and gcode >= 0 and gcode <= 999 then
  return 'G' .. string.format('%02d', gcode)
else
  return 'No_GCode'
end

items.name: CPU
items.script:
-- CPU usage percentage
local cpu = tonumber(result)
if cpu and cpu >= 0 and cpu <= 100 then
  if cpu > 80 then
    return 'HIGH'
  elseif cpu > 50 then
    return 'MEDIUM'
  else
    return 'LOW'
  end
else
  return 'UNKNOWN'
end

httpServerSource.description: Starts an HTTP server and listens to HTTP POST requests

uri.description: URL to listen for POST requests

items.description: List of items for the connector

examples.name: httpApiServer
examples.init_script:
-- Initialize HTTP Server for data collection
print('HTTP Server connector initialized on port 8081')
-- Import JSON library for parsing POST data
json = require('json')
stringx = require('pl.stringx')
-- Initialize data validation functions
function validateTemperature(temp)
  return temp and temp >= -40 and temp <= 150
end
function validatePressure(pressure)
  return pressure and pressure >= 0 and pressure <= 1000
end
function validatePartCount(count)
  return count and count >= 0 and count <= 999999
end
examples.enter_script:
-- Log HTTP data collection cycle
-- print('HTTP Server polling for new requests')
examples.exit_script:
-- Calculate overall system health score
local tempOK = cache('./TemperatureSensor1/status', 'OK') == 'OK'
local pressureOK = cache('./PressureSensor1/status', 'OK') == 'OK'
local productionOK = cache('./ProductionLine1/status', 'Running') == 'Running'
local healthScore = 0
if tempOK then healthScore = healthScore + 33 end
if pressureOK then healthScore = healthScore + 33 end
if productionOK then healthScore = healthScore + 34 end
emit('./SystemHealth', math.floor(healthScore))

items.name: SensorData
items.script:
-- Process sensor data from POST requests
if not result or result == '' then
  return nil
end
local data = json.decode(result)
if not data then
  return nil
end
-- Extract and validate sensor readings
local sensorId = data.sensorId or 'unknown'
local value = tonumber(data.value)
local timestamp = data.timestamp or os.time()
local sensorType = data.type or 'generic'
-- Emit individual sensor readings
if value then
  emit('./Sensor_' .. sensorId, value)
  emit('./Sensor_' .. sensorId .. '/timestamp', timestamp)
  emit('./Sensor_' .. sensorId .. '/type', sensorType)
end
-- Return summary for this item
return sensorId .. ': ' .. (value or 'invalid')

items.name: TemperatureSensor1
items.script:
-- Process temperature sensor data
if not result or result == '' then
  return nil
end
local data = json.decode(result)
if not data then
  return nil
end
local temp = tonumber(data.temperature)
local unit = data.unit or 'C'
local location = data.location or 'unknown'
-- Validate temperature reading
if validateTemperature(temp) then
  emit('./TemperatureSensor1/value', temp)
  emit('./TemperatureSensor1/unit', unit)
  emit('./TemperatureSensor1/location', location)
  emit('./TemperatureSensor1/status', 'OK')
  return temp
else
  emit('./TemperatureSensor1/status', 'Error')
  return nil
end

items.name: PressureSensor1
items.script:
-- Process pressure sensor data
if not result or result == '' then
  return nil
end
local data = json.decode(result)
if not data then
  return nil
end
local pressure = tonumber(data.pressure)
local unit = data.unit or 'PSI'
local system = data.system or 'hydraulic'
-- Validate pressure reading
if validatePressure(pressure) then
  emit('./PressureSensor1/value', pressure)
  emit('./PressureSensor1/unit', unit)
  emit('./PressureSensor1/system', system)
  emit('./PressureSensor1/status', 'OK')
  return pressure
else
  emit('./PressureSensor1/status', 'Error')
  return nil
end

items.name: ProductionLine1
items.script:
-- Process production line data
if not result or result == '' then
  return nil
end
local data = json.decode(result)
if not data then
  return nil
end
local status = data.status or 'Unknown'
local partCount = tonumber(data.partCount)
local cycleTime = tonumber(data.cycleTime)
local operator = data.operator or 'Unknown'
-- Emit production metrics
emit('./ProductionLine1/status', status)
if validatePartCount(partCount) then
  emit('./ProductionLine1/partCount', partCount)
end
if cycleTime and cycleTime > 0 and cycleTime < 600 then
  emit('./ProductionLine1/cycleTime', cycleTime)
end
emit('./ProductionLine1/operator', operator)
-- Return status summary
return status .. ' - Parts: ' .. (partCount or 'N/A')

items.name: QualityData
items.script:
-- Process quality inspection data
if not result or result == '' then
  return nil
end
local data = json.decode(result)
if not data then
  return nil
end
local inspectionId = data.inspectionId or 'unknown'
local result_status = data.result or 'Unknown'
local defectCount = tonumber(data.defectCount) or 0
local inspector = data.inspector or 'Auto'
local timestamp = data.timestamp or os.time()
-- Emit quality metrics
emit('./QualityData/inspectionId', inspectionId)
emit('./QualityData/result', result_status)
emit('./QualityData/defectCount', defectCount)
emit('./QualityData/inspector', inspector)
emit('./QualityData/timestamp', timestamp)
-- Calculate pass/fail
local passed = result_status == 'PASS' or defectCount == 0
return passed and 'Pass' or 'Fail'

items.name: AlarmNotification
items.script:
-- Process alarm notifications
if not result or result == '' then
  return nil
end
local data = json.decode(result)
if not data then
  return nil
end
local alarmId = data.alarmId or 'unknown'
local severity = data.severity or 'INFO'
local message = data.message or 'No message'
local source = data.source or 'unknown'
local timestamp = data.timestamp or os.time()
-- Format alarm message
local formattedAlarm = '[' .. severity .. '] ' .. source .. ': ' .. message
-- Emit alarm details
emit('./AlarmNotification/alarmId', alarmId)
emit('./AlarmNotification/severity', severity)
emit('./AlarmNotification/source', source)
emit('./AlarmNotification/timestamp', timestamp)
return formattedAlarm

items.name: MaintenanceRequest
items.script:
-- Process maintenance requests
if not result or result == '' then
  return nil
end
local data = json.decode(result)
if not data then
  return nil
end
local equipmentId = data.equipmentId or 'unknown'
local requestType = data.requestType or 'unknown'
local priority = data.priority or 'LOW'
local description = data.description or 'No description'
local requestedBy = data.requestedBy or 'System'
-- Emit maintenance details
emit('./MaintenanceRequest/equipmentId', equipmentId)
emit('./MaintenanceRequest/requestType', requestType)
emit('./MaintenanceRequest/priority', priority)
emit('./MaintenanceRequest/requestedBy', requestedBy)
-- Return formatted request
return equipmentId .. ' - ' .. requestType .. ' (' .. priority .. ')'

items.name: EnergyMonitor
items.script:
-- Process energy consumption data
if not result or result == '' then
  return nil
end
local data = json.decode(result)
if not data then
  return nil
end
local meterId = data.meterId or 'unknown'
local powerKW = tonumber(data.powerKW)
local voltageV = tonumber(data.voltageV)
local currentA = tonumber(data.currentA)
local energyKWh = tonumber(data.energyKWh)
-- Validate and emit energy metrics
if powerKW and powerKW >= 0 and powerKW <= 1000 then
  emit('./EnergyMonitor/' .. meterId .. '/power', powerKW)
end
if voltageV and voltageV >= 0 and voltageV <= 600 then
  emit('./EnergyMonitor/' .. meterId .. '/voltage', voltageV)
end
if currentA and currentA >= 0 and currentA <= 500 then
  emit('./EnergyMonitor/' .. meterId .. '/current', currentA)
end
if energyKWh and energyKWh >= 0 then
  emit('./EnergyMonitor/' .. meterId .. '/energy', energyKWh)
end
return meterId .. ': ' .. (powerKW or 'N/A') .. ' kW'

items.name: InventoryUpdate
items.script:
-- Process inventory updates
if not result or result == '' then
  return nil
end
local data = json.decode(result)
if not data then
  return nil
end
local partNumber = data.partNumber or 'unknown'
local quantity = tonumber(data.quantity)
local location = data.location or 'unknown'
local operation = data.operation or 'unknown'
local timestamp = data.timestamp or os.time()
-- Emit inventory details
emit('./InventoryUpdate/' .. partNumber .. '/quantity', quantity or 0)
emit('./InventoryUpdate/' .. partNumber .. '/location', location)
emit('./InventoryUpdate/' .. partNumber .. '/operation', operation)
emit('./InventoryUpdate/' .. partNumber .. '/timestamp', timestamp)
-- Return formatted update
return partNumber .. ': ' .. (quantity or 0) .. ' @ ' .. location

items.name: OperatorMessage
items.script:
-- Process operator messages
if not result or result == '' then
  return nil
end
local data = json.decode(result)
if not data then
  return nil
end
local operatorId = data.operatorId or 'unknown'
local message = data.message or 'No message'
local station = data.station or 'unknown'
local priority = data.priority or 'NORMAL'
local timestamp = data.timestamp or os.time()
-- Clean and format message
message = string.gsub(message, '^%s*(.-)%s*$', '%1')
-- Emit operator communication
emit('./OperatorMessage/operatorId', operatorId)
emit('./OperatorMessage/station', station)
emit('./OperatorMessage/priority', priority)
emit('./OperatorMessage/timestamp', timestamp)
return '[' .. operatorId .. '] ' .. message

items.name: BatchTracker
items.script:
-- Process batch tracking data
if not result or result == '' then
  return nil
end
local data = json.decode(result)
if not data then
  return nil
end
local batchId = data.batchId or 'unknown'
local status = data.status or 'unknown'
local progress = tonumber(data.progress) or 0
local startTime = data.startTime
local estimatedCompletion = data.estimatedCompletion
-- Emit batch tracking details
emit('./BatchTracker/' .. batchId .. '/status', status)
emit('./BatchTracker/' .. batchId .. '/progress', progress)
if startTime then
  emit('./BatchTracker/' .. batchId .. '/startTime', startTime)
end
if estimatedCompletion then
  emit('./BatchTracker/' .. batchId .. '/estimatedCompletion', estimatedCompletion)
end
return batchId .. ': ' .. status .. ' (' .. progress .. '%)'

items.name: GenericWebhook
items.script:
-- Process generic webhook data
if not result or result == '' then
  return nil
end
-- Try to parse as JSON, fallback to raw text
local success, data = pcall(json.decode, result)
if success and data then
  -- JSON payload
  local source = data.source or 'webhook'
  local event = data.event or 'generic'
  local payload = data.payload or data
  emit('./GenericWebhook/source', source)
  emit('./GenericWebhook/event', event)
  return source .. ': ' .. event
else
  -- Raw text payload
  local cleanData = string.gsub(result, '^%s*(.-)%s*$', '%1')
  return 'Raw: ' .. string.sub(cleanData, 1, 100)
end

jsonWebScraperSource.description: Reads data from a JSON web page

items.description: List of items for the connector

examples.name: jsonApiScraper
examples.init_script:
-- Initialize JSON Web Scraper
print('JSON Web Scraper connector initialized')
-- Import JSON library for additional processing
json = require('json')
stringx = require('pl.stringx')
-- Define data validation functions
function validateTemperature(temp)
  return temp and temp >= -50 and temp <= 200
end
function validatePercentage(pct)
  return pct and pct >= 0 and pct <= 100
end
function formatTimestamp(ts)
  if ts then
    return os.date('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S', ts)
  else
    return 'Unknown'
  end
end
examples.enter_script:
-- Log scraping cycle start
-- print('Starting JSON data scraping cycle')
examples.exit_script:
-- Calculate overall facility efficiency
local line1Eff = cache('./ProductionLine1/efficiency', 0)
local line2Eff = cache('./ProductionLine2/efficiency', 0)
local line3Eff = cache('./ProductionLine3/efficiency', 0)
local avgEfficiency = (line1Eff + line2Eff + line3Eff) / 3
emit('./FacilityEfficiency', math.floor(avgEfficiency * 10) / 10)

items.name: SystemStatus
items.script:
-- Process overall system status
local status = tostring(result or 'Unknown')
local statusMap = {
  ['online'] = 'Online',
  ['offline'] = 'Offline',
  ['maintenance'] = 'Maintenance',
  ['error'] = 'Error'
}
return statusMap[string.lower(status)] or status

items.name: ProductionLine1
items.script:
-- Process production line 1 data
if not result then return nil end
local line = json.decode(result)
if not line then return nil end
-- Extract line data
local lineId = line.id or 'Line1'
local status = line.status or 'Unknown'
local output = tonumber(line.currentOutput) or 0
local target = tonumber(line.targetOutput) or 1
local efficiency = math.floor((output / target) * 100 * 10) / 10
local operator = line.operator or 'Unknown'
-- Emit individual metrics
emit('./ProductionLine1/status', status)
emit('./ProductionLine1/output', output)
emit('./ProductionLine1/target', target)
emit('./ProductionLine1/efficiency', efficiency)
emit('./ProductionLine1/operator', operator)
return status .. ' - ' .. output .. '/' .. target .. ' (' .. efficiency .. '%)'

items.name: ProductionLine2
items.script:
-- Process production line 2 data
if not result then return nil end
local line = json.decode(result)
if not line then return nil end
-- Extract and validate data
local status = line.status or 'Unknown'
local output = tonumber(line.currentOutput) or 0
local target = tonumber(line.targetOutput) or 1
local efficiency = math.floor((output / target) * 100 * 10) / 10
-- Emit metrics
emit('./ProductionLine2/status', status)
emit('./ProductionLine2/output', output)
emit('./ProductionLine2/efficiency', efficiency)
return status .. ' - Efficiency: ' .. efficiency .. '%'

items.name: ProductionLine3
items.script:
-- Process production line 3 data
if not result then return nil end
local line = json.decode(result)
if not line then return nil end
-- Extract data
local status = line.status or 'Unknown'
local output = tonumber(line.currentOutput) or 0
local target = tonumber(line.targetOutput) or 1
local efficiency = math.floor((output / target) * 100 * 10) / 10
-- Emit metrics
emit('./ProductionLine3/status', status)
emit('./ProductionLine3/output', output)
emit('./ProductionLine3/efficiency', efficiency)
return status .. ' - Output: ' .. output

items.name: EnvironmentalData
items.script:
-- Process environmental sensor data
if not result then return nil end
local env = json.decode(result)
if not env then return nil end
-- Extract environmental metrics
local temperature = tonumber(env.temperature)
local humidity = tonumber(env.humidity)
local airQuality = env.airQuality or 'Unknown'
local co2Level = tonumber(env.co2Level)
-- Validate and emit data
if validateTemperature(temperature) then
  emit('./EnvironmentalData/temperature', temperature)
end
if validatePercentage(humidity) then
  emit('./EnvironmentalData/humidity', humidity)
end
emit('./EnvironmentalData/airQuality', airQuality)
if co2Level and co2Level >= 0 and co2Level <= 5000 then
  emit('./EnvironmentalData/co2Level', co2Level)
end
return 'Temp: ' .. (temperature or 'N/A') .. 'C, Humidity: ' .. (humidity or 'N/A') .. '%'

items.name: EnergyConsumption
items.script:
-- Process total energy consumption
local consumption = tonumber(result)
if consumption and consumption >= 0 and consumption <= 10000 then
  return math.floor(consumption * 100) / 100
else
  return cache('./EnergyConsumption', 0)
end

items.name: QualityMetrics
items.script:
-- Process quality metrics
if not result then return nil end
local quality = json.decode(result)
if not quality then return nil end
-- Extract quality data
local passRate = tonumber(quality.passRate) or 0
local defectRate = tonumber(quality.defectRate) or 0
local totalInspected = tonumber(quality.totalInspected) or 0
local lastInspection = quality.lastInspectionTime
-- Emit quality metrics
emit('./QualityMetrics/passRate', passRate)
emit('./QualityMetrics/defectRate', defectRate)
emit('./QualityMetrics/totalInspected', totalInspected)
if lastInspection then
  emit('./QualityMetrics/lastInspection', lastInspection)
end
return 'Pass Rate: ' .. passRate .. '%, Defects: ' .. defectRate .. '%'

items.name: ActiveAlarms
items.script:
-- Process active alarms array
if not result then return nil end
local alarms = json.decode(result)
if not alarms or type(alarms) ~= 'table' then return nil end
-- Process each alarm
local alarmCount = 0
local highPriorityCount = 0
for i, alarm in ipairs(alarms) do
  if alarm.id then
    alarmCount = alarmCount + 1
    local severity = string.upper(alarm.severity or 'LOW')
    if severity == 'HIGH' or severity == 'CRITICAL' then
      highPriorityCount = highPriorityCount + 1
    end
    -- Emit individual alarm
    emit('./ActiveAlarms/alarm_' .. alarm.id, alarm.message or 'No message')
    emit('./ActiveAlarms/alarm_' .. alarm.id .. '_severity', severity)
  end
end
-- Emit summary metrics
emit('./ActiveAlarms/totalCount', alarmCount)
emit('./ActiveAlarms/highPriorityCount', highPriorityCount)
return 'Total: ' .. alarmCount .. ', High Priority: ' .. highPriorityCount

items.name: MaintenanceSchedule
items.script:
-- Process next maintenance schedule
if not result then return nil end
local maintenance = json.decode(result)
if not maintenance then return nil end
-- Extract maintenance info
local equipmentId = maintenance.equipmentId or 'Unknown'
local maintenanceType = maintenance.type or 'Unknown'
local scheduledDate = maintenance.scheduledDate
local daysUntil = tonumber(maintenance.daysUntil)
-- Format response
local response = equipmentId .. ' - ' .. maintenanceType
if daysUntil then
  response = response .. ' (in ' .. daysUntil .. ' days)'
end
return response

items.name: InventoryLevels
items.script:
-- Process inventory levels
if not result then return nil end
local inventory = json.decode(result)
if not inventory or type(inventory) ~= 'table' then return nil end
-- Process inventory items
local lowStockCount = 0
local totalItems = 0
for i, item in ipairs(inventory) do
  if item.partNumber then
    totalItems = totalItems + 1
    local quantity = tonumber(item.quantity) or 0
    local minimum = tonumber(item.minimum) or 0
    -- Check for low stock
    if quantity <= minimum then
      lowStockCount = lowStockCount + 1
    end
    -- Emit individual item levels
    emit('./InventoryLevels/' .. item.partNumber, quantity)
    emit('./InventoryLevels/' .. item.partNumber .. '_status', quantity <= minimum and 'Low' or 'OK')
  end
end
-- Emit summary
emit('./InventoryLevels/totalItems', totalItems)
emit('./InventoryLevels/lowStockCount', lowStockCount)
return 'Items: ' .. totalItems .. ', Low Stock: ' .. lowStockCount

items.name: OperatorShift
items.script:
-- Process current shift information
if not result then return nil end
local shift = json.decode(result)
if not shift then return nil end
-- Extract shift data
local shiftName = shift.name or 'Unknown'
local supervisor = shift.supervisor or 'Unknown'
local operatorCount = tonumber(shift.operatorCount) or 0
local startTime = shift.startTime
local endTime = shift.endTime
-- Emit shift details
emit('./OperatorShift/name', shiftName)
emit('./OperatorShift/supervisor', supervisor)
emit('./OperatorShift/operatorCount', operatorCount)
if startTime then
  emit('./OperatorShift/startTime', startTime)
end
if endTime then
  emit('./OperatorShift/endTime', endTime)
end
return shiftName .. ' - ' .. supervisor .. ' (' .. operatorCount .. ' operators)'

items.name: WeatherData
items.script:
-- Process weather data for outdoor operations
if not result then return nil end
local weather = json.decode(result)
if not weather then return nil end
-- Extract weather information
local temperature = tonumber(weather.temperature)
local humidity = tonumber(weather.humidity)
local windSpeed = tonumber(weather.windSpeed)
local conditions = weather.conditions or 'Unknown'
-- Emit weather data
if temperature then
  emit('./WeatherData/temperature', temperature)
end
if humidity then
  emit('./WeatherData/humidity', humidity)
end
if windSpeed then
  emit('./WeatherData/windSpeed', windSpeed)
end
emit('./WeatherData/conditions', conditions)
return conditions .. ' - ' .. (temperature or 'N/A') .. 'C'

items.name: ProductionTargets
items.script:
-- Process daily production targets
if not result then return nil end
local targets = json.decode(result)
if not targets then return nil end
-- Extract target information
local totalTarget = tonumber(targets.total) or 0
local currentProgress = tonumber(targets.currentProgress) or 0
local percentComplete = totalTarget > 0 and (currentProgress / totalTarget * 100) or 0
local hoursRemaining = tonumber(targets.hoursRemaining) or 0
-- Emit target metrics
emit('./ProductionTargets/total', totalTarget)
emit('./ProductionTargets/currentProgress', currentProgress)
emit('./ProductionTargets/percentComplete', math.floor(percentComplete * 10) / 10)
emit('./ProductionTargets/hoursRemaining', hoursRemaining)
return currentProgress .. '/' .. totalTarget .. ' (' .. math.floor(percentComplete) .. '%)'

modbusTcpSource.description: Reads data from a Modbus/TCP device

items.description: List of items for the connector

examples.name: modbusDevice1
examples.init_script:
-- Initialize Modbus TCP processing
print('Modbus TCP connector initialized')
-- Import struct library for multi-register processing
struct = require('struct')
-- Define register type mappings
RegisterTypes = {
  [1] = 'Coil',
  [2] = 'Input',
  [3] = 'Holding',
  [4] = 'Input_Register'
}
-- Define alarm state mappings
AlarmStates = {
  [0] = 'Normal',
  [1] = 'Warning',
  [2] = 'Alarm',
  [3] = 'Critical'
}
-- Data validation functions
function validateTemperature(temp)
  return temp and temp >= -40 and temp <= 150
end
function validatePressure(pressure)
  return pressure and pressure >= 0 and pressure <= 1000
end
examples.enter_script:
-- Log Modbus read cycle start
-- print('Starting Modbus TCP read cycle')
examples.exit_script:
-- Calculate overall equipment effectiveness
local isRunning = cache('./SystemRunning', false)
local quality = cache('./QualityRate', 100)
local availability = cache('./SystemAvailable', false)
local performance = cache('./PerformanceRate', 100)
if isRunning and availability then
  local oee = (quality * performance) / 10000
  emit('./OverallEquipmentEffectiveness', math.floor(oee * 100) / 100)
end

items.name: SystemAvailability
items.script:
-- Calculate system availability
local isConnected = cache('./$SYSTEM/IsConnected', false)
local systemRunning = cache('./SystemRunning', false)
local hasAlarms = cache('./AlarmStatus', 0) > 0
if not isConnected then
  return 'Unavailable'
elseif hasAlarms then
  return 'Fault'
elseif systemRunning then
  return 'Available'
else
  return 'Stopped'
end

items.name: SystemRunning
items.script:
-- System running status from coil
local running = result and result[1] == 1
return running

items.name: EmergencyStop
items.script:
-- Emergency stop status (normally closed)
local estop = result and result[1] == 0
return estop and 'Activated' or 'Normal'

items.name: MotorStatus
items.script:
-- Process multiple motor status bits
if not result or #result < 8 then return nil end
local motors = {}
for i = 1, 8 do
  local motorRunning = result[i] == 1
  motors[i] = motorRunning and 'Running' or 'Stopped'
  emit('./Motor' .. i .. 'Status', motors[i])
end
-- Count running motors
local runningCount = 0
for i = 1, 8 do
  if result[i] == 1 then runningCount = runningCount + 1 end
end
return runningCount .. '/8 motors running'

items.name: InputSignals
items.script:
-- Process digital input signals
if not result or #result < 16 then return nil end
-- Define input meanings
local inputNames = {
  'Door_Closed', 'Safety_OK', 'Part_Present', 'Tool_Ready',
  'Coolant_Level_OK', 'Air_Pressure_OK', 'Hydraulic_OK', 'Conveyor_Ready',
  'Quality_Gate_Pass', 'Maintenance_Required', 'Operator_Present', 'Cycle_Start',
  'Home_Position', 'Jog_Enable', 'Manual_Mode', 'Auto_Mode'
}
-- Emit individual input states
local activeInputs = 0
for i = 1, 16 do
  local inputActive = result[i] == 1
  local inputName = inputNames[i] or ('Input_' .. i)
  emit('./InputSignals/' .. inputName, inputActive)
  if inputActive then activeInputs = activeInputs + 1 end
end
return activeInputs .. ' active inputs'

items.name: PartCount
items.script:
-- Parts produced count
local count = result and result[1] or 0
if count >= 0 and count <= 999999 then
  return count
else
  return cache('./PartCount', 0)
end

items.name: RejectCount
items.script:
-- Rejected parts count
local rejects = result and result[1] or 0
if rejects >= 0 then
  return rejects
else
  return cache('./RejectCount', 0)
end

items.name: SetPoint
items.script:
-- Process setpoint value (scaled)
local setpoint = result and result[1] or 0
-- Convert from raw value to engineering units
local engineeringValue = setpoint / 10.0
if engineeringValue >= 0 and engineeringValue <= 6553.5 then
  return math.floor(engineeringValue * 10) / 10
else
  return 0
end

items.name: AlarmStatus
items.script:
-- Process alarm status register
local alarmWord = result and result[1] or 0
local alarmCount = 0
-- Check individual alarm bits
local alarmNames = {
  'Temperature_High', 'Pressure_Low', 'Vibration_High', 'Oil_Level_Low',
  'Overload', 'Communication_Error', 'Power_Supply_Fault', 'Safety_Circuit',
  'Tool_Wear', 'Cycle_Time_Exceeded', 'Quality_Fail', 'Maintenance_Due',
  'Emergency_Stop', 'Door_Open', 'Air_Pressure_Low', 'Reserved'
}
for bit = 0, 15 do
  local alarmActive = (alarmWord & (1 << bit)) ~= 0
  local alarmName = alarmNames[bit + 1] or ('Alarm_Bit_' .. bit)
  emit('./AlarmStatus/' .. alarmName, alarmActive)
  if alarmActive then alarmCount = alarmCount + 1 end
end
return alarmCount

items.name: Temperature32Bit
items.script:
-- Process 32-bit temperature value (IEEE 754 float)
if not result or #result < 2 then return nil end
-- Convert two 16-bit registers to 32-bit float
local temp = struct.unpack('<f', struct.pack('<HH', result[1], result[2]))
if validateTemperature(temp) then
  return math.floor(temp * 100) / 100
else
  return nil
end

items.name: Pressure32Bit
items.script:
-- Process 32-bit pressure value
if not result or #result < 2 then return nil end
-- Convert to 32-bit unsigned integer, then scale
local pressureRaw = struct.unpack('<I', struct.pack('<HH', result[1], result[2]))
local pressure = pressureRaw / 1000.0  -- Scale to PSI
if validatePressure(pressure) then
  return math.floor(pressure * 100) / 100
else
  return nil
end

items.name: VibrationXYZ
items.script:
-- Process XYZ vibration readings
if not result or #result < 3 then return nil end
-- Extract and scale vibration values
local vibX = (result[1] - 32768) / 1000.0  -- Convert to signed, scale to g
local vibY = (result[2] - 32768) / 1000.0
local vibZ = (result[3] - 32768) / 1000.0
-- Emit individual axis values
emit('./VibrationXYZ/X', math.floor(vibX * 1000) / 1000)
emit('./VibrationXYZ/Y', math.floor(vibY * 1000) / 1000)
emit('./VibrationXYZ/Z', math.floor(vibZ * 1000) / 1000)
-- Calculate magnitude
local magnitude = math.sqrt(vibX*vibX + vibY*vibY + vibZ*vibZ)
return math.floor(magnitude * 1000) / 1000

items.name: SpeedFeedback
items.script:
-- Motor speed feedback from input register
local speedRaw = result and result[1] or 0
-- Convert to RPM (assuming 0-65535 maps to 0-3000 RPM)
local speedRPM = (speedRaw / 65535.0) * 3000
if speedRPM >= 0 and speedRPM <= 3000 then
  return math.floor(speedRPM)
else
  return 0
end

items.name: PowerConsumption
items.script:
-- Power consumption in watts
local powerRaw = result and result[1] or 0
-- Scale to watts (0-65535 maps to 0-50000W)
local powerWatts = (powerRaw / 65535.0) * 50000
if powerWatts >= 0 and powerWatts <= 50000 then
  return math.floor(powerWatts)
else
  return 0
end

items.name: FlowRate
items.script:
-- Coolant flow rate
local flowRaw = result and result[1] or 0
-- Convert to GPM (gallons per minute)
local flowGPM = (flowRaw / 65535.0) * 100
if flowGPM >= 0 and flowGPM <= 100 then
  return math.floor(flowGPM * 10) / 10
else
  return 0
end

items.name: AnalogInputs
items.script:
-- Process multiple analog inputs
if not result or #result < 8 then return nil end
-- Define analog input purposes
local inputNames = {
  'Tank_Level', 'Oil_Pressure', 'Air_Pressure', 'Hydraulic_Pressure',
  'Spindle_Load', 'Feed_Force', 'Clamp_Pressure', 'Conveyor_Speed'
}
-- Process each analog input
local analogSummary = {}
for i = 1, 8 do
  local rawValue = result[i]
  local scaledValue = (rawValue / 65535.0) * 100  -- Scale to 0-100%
  local inputName = inputNames[i] or ('Analog_' .. i)
  emit('./AnalogInputs/' .. inputName, math.floor(scaledValue * 10) / 10)
  analogSummary[i] = math.floor(scaledValue)
end
return table.concat(analogSummary, ',')

items.name: QualityMetrics
items.script:
-- Process quality metrics
if not result or #result < 4 then return nil end
-- Extract quality data
local totalParts = result[1] or 0
local goodParts = result[2] or 0
local rejectParts = result[3] or 0
local reworkParts = result[4] or 0
-- Calculate quality metrics
local qualityRate = totalParts > 0 and (goodParts / totalParts * 100) or 100
local rejectRate = totalParts > 0 and (rejectParts / totalParts * 100) or 0
local reworkRate = totalParts > 0 and (reworkParts / totalParts * 100) or 0
-- Emit quality metrics
emit('./QualityMetrics/totalParts', totalParts)
emit('./QualityMetrics/goodParts', goodParts)
emit('./QualityMetrics/qualityRate', math.floor(qualityRate * 10) / 10)
emit('./QualityMetrics/rejectRate', math.floor(rejectRate * 10) / 10)
emit('./QualityMetrics/reworkRate', math.floor(reworkRate * 10) / 10)
return 'Quality: ' .. math.floor(qualityRate) .. '%, Rejects: ' .. math.floor(rejectRate) .. '%'

items.name: ProcessParameters
items.script:
-- Process control parameters
if not result or #result < 6 then return nil end
-- Extract process parameters (scaled values)
local feedRate = result[1] / 10.0  -- Feed rate in IPM
local spindleSpeed = result[2]      -- Spindle speed in RPM
local cutDepth = result[3] / 1000.0 -- Cut depth in inches
local toolLife = result[4]          -- Tool life percentage
local cycleTime = result[5] / 10.0  -- Cycle time in seconds
local coolantTemp = result[6] / 10.0 -- Coolant temperature in C
-- Emit process parameters
emit('./ProcessParameters/feedRate', feedRate)
emit('./ProcessParameters/spindleSpeed', spindleSpeed)
emit('./ProcessParameters/cutDepth', cutDepth)
emit('./ProcessParameters/toolLife', toolLife)
emit('./ProcessParameters/cycleTime', cycleTime)
emit('./ProcessParameters/coolantTemp', coolantTemp)
return 'Feed: ' .. feedRate .. ' IPM, Speed: ' .. spindleSpeed .. ' RPM'

items.name: MaintenanceCounters
items.script:
-- Process maintenance counters
if not result or #result < 4 then return nil end
-- Extract maintenance data (32-bit values using pairs of registers)
local operatingHours = struct.unpack('<I', struct.pack('<HH', result[1], result[2]))
local cycleCount = struct.unpack('<I', struct.pack('<HH', result[3], result[4]))
-- Emit maintenance counters
emit('./MaintenanceCounters/operatingHours', operatingHours)
emit('./MaintenanceCounters/cycleCount', cycleCount)
-- Calculate hours since last maintenance (assuming 500 hour intervals)
local hoursSinceMaint = operatingHours % 500
local hoursUntilMaint = 500 - hoursSinceMaint
emit('./MaintenanceCounters/hoursUntilMaintenance', hoursUntilMaint)
return 'Hours: ' .. operatingHours .. ', Next maintenance in: ' .. hoursUntilMaint .. 'h'

examples.name: mqttBroker1
examples.init_script:
-- Initialize MQTT data processing
print('MQTT connector initialized')
-- Import JSON library for message parsing
json = require('json')
stringx = require('pl.stringx')
moses = require('moses')
-- Initialize data validation functions
function validateTemperature(temp)
  return temp and temp >= -50 and temp <= 200
end
function validateHumidity(hum)
  return hum and hum >= 0 and hum <= 100
end
function validatePressure(pressure)
  return pressure and pressure >= 0 and pressure <= 1000
end
-- Initialize moving average arrays
temperatureBuffer = {}
pressureBuffer = {}
examples.enter_script:
-- Log MQTT message processing cycle
-- print('MQTT message processing cycle started')
examples.exit_script:
-- Calculate facility-wide metrics
local activeDevices = 0
local totalEnergy = 0
for i = 1, 10 do
  if cache('./Device' .. i .. '/status', 'offline') == 'online' then
    activeDevices = activeDevices + 1
  end
  local energy = cache('./Device' .. i .. '/energy', 0)
  totalEnergy = totalEnergy + energy
end
emit('./FacilityMetrics/activeDevices', activeDevices)
emit('./FacilityMetrics/totalEnergyConsumption', totalEnergy)
examples.item_script:
-- Default processing for items without their own script
local topic = this.Key or 'unknown'
local payload = result or ''
-- Extract device ID from topic if following standard pattern
local deviceId = string.match(topic, 'factory/([^/]+)/')
if not deviceId then return payload end
-- Try to parse as JSON, fallback to raw value
local success, data = pcall(json.decode, payload)
if success and data then
  -- For JSON payloads, try to extract a meaningful value
  local value = data.value or data.data or data.measurement
  if value ~= nil then
    emit('./Device' .. deviceId .. '/lastUpdate', os.time())
    return value
  else
    return payload
  end
else
  -- For non-JSON payloads, return as-is
  emit('./Device' .. deviceId .. '/lastUpdate', os.time())
  return payload
end

items.name: TemperatureSensors
items.script:
-- Custom processing for temperature data (overrides item_script)
local topic = this.Key or 'unknown'
local deviceId = string.match(topic, 'factory/([^/]+)/')
if not deviceId then return nil end
-- Parse temperature data
local success, data = pcall(json.decode, result)
if not success or not data then return nil end
local temperature = tonumber(data.value or data.temperature)
local unit = data.unit or 'C'
local sensorId = data.sensorId or 'temp1'
-- Validate temperature
if not validateTemperature(temperature) then
  emit('./Device' .. deviceId .. '/temperature/error', 'Invalid temperature')
  return nil
end
-- Store in moving average buffer
table.insert(temperatureBuffer, temperature)
temperatureBuffer = moses.last(temperatureBuffer, 10)
local avgTemp = moses.mean(temperatureBuffer)
-- Emit temperature data
emit('./Device' .. deviceId .. '/temperature', temperature)
emit('./Device' .. deviceId .. '/temperature/unit', unit)
emit('./Device' .. deviceId .. '/temperature/average', math.floor(avgTemp * 10) / 10)
return deviceId .. ': ' .. temperature .. '' .. unit

items.name: ProductionData
items.script:
-- Custom processing for production data (overrides item_script)
local topic = this.Key or 'unknown'
local deviceId = string.match(topic, 'factory/([^/]+)/')
if not deviceId then return nil end
-- Parse production data
local success, data = pcall(json.decode, result)
if not success or not data then return nil end
local partCount = tonumber(data.partCount or data.count)
local goodParts = tonumber(data.goodParts)
local rejectParts = tonumber(data.rejectParts)
local operator = data.operator or 'Unknown'
-- Validate part count
if not partCount or partCount < 0 then return nil end
-- Emit production metrics
emit('./Device' .. deviceId .. '/production/partCount', partCount)
if goodParts then
  emit('./Device' .. deviceId .. '/production/goodParts', goodParts)
end
if rejectParts then
  emit('./Device' .. deviceId .. '/production/rejectParts', rejectParts)
  local qualityRate = goodParts and goodParts > 0 and (goodParts / (goodParts + rejectParts) * 100) or 100
  emit('./Device' .. deviceId .. '/production/qualityRate', math.floor(qualityRate * 10) / 10)
end
emit('./Device' .. deviceId .. '/production/operator', operator)
return deviceId .. ': ' .. partCount .. ' parts'

items.name: AlarmNotifications
items.script:
-- Custom alarm processing (overrides item_script)
local topic = this.Key or 'unknown'
local deviceId = string.match(topic, 'factory/([^/]+)/')
local alarmType = string.match(topic, 'alarms/([^/]+)')
if not deviceId or not alarmType then return nil end
-- Parse alarm data
local success, data = pcall(json.decode, result)
if not success or not data then
  -- Simple alarm message
  emit('./Device' .. deviceId .. '/alarms/' .. alarmType, result)
  return deviceId .. ': ' .. alarmType .. ' - ' .. result
end
-- Structured alarm data
local severity = data.severity or 'INFO'
local message = data.message or 'No message'
local timestamp = data.timestamp or os.time()
-- Emit alarm details
emit('./Device' .. deviceId .. '/alarms/' .. alarmType .. '/severity', severity)
emit('./Device' .. deviceId .. '/alarms/' .. alarmType .. '/message', message)
emit('./Device' .. deviceId .. '/alarms/' .. alarmType .. '/timestamp', timestamp)
return '[' .. severity .. '] ' .. deviceId .. '/' .. alarmType .. ': ' .. message

items.name: EnergyData
items.script:
-- Custom energy processing (overrides item_script)
local topic = this.Key or 'unknown'
local deviceId = string.match(topic, 'factory/([^/]+)/')
if not deviceId then return nil end
-- Parse energy data
local success, data = pcall(json.decode, result)
if not success or not data then return nil end
local powerKW = tonumber(data.powerKW or data.power)
local energyKWh = tonumber(data.energyKWh or data.energy)
local voltage = tonumber(data.voltage)
-- Validate and emit energy data
if powerKW and powerKW >= 0 and powerKW <= 1000 then
  emit('./Device' .. deviceId .. '/energy/power', powerKW)
end
if energyKWh and energyKWh >= 0 then
  emit('./Device' .. deviceId .. '/energy/consumption', energyKWh)
end
if voltage and voltage >= 0 and voltage <= 600 then
  emit('./Device' .. deviceId .. '/energy/voltage', voltage)
end
return deviceId .. ': ' .. (powerKW or 'N/A') .. ' kW'

items.name: QualityInspection
items.script:
-- Custom quality processing (overrides item_script)
local topic = this.Key or 'unknown'
local deviceId = string.match(topic, 'factory/([^/]+)/')
if not deviceId then return nil end
-- Parse quality data
local success, data = pcall(json.decode, result)
if not success or not data then return nil end
local inspectionId = data.inspectionId or 'unknown'
local result_status = data.result or data.status or 'Unknown'
local defectCount = tonumber(data.defectCount) or 0
local inspector = data.inspector or 'Auto'
local partNumber = data.partNumber or 'Unknown'
-- Emit quality data
emit('./Device' .. deviceId .. '/quality/inspectionId', inspectionId)
emit('./Device' .. deviceId .. '/quality/result', result_status)
emit('./Device' .. deviceId .. '/quality/defectCount', defectCount)
emit('./Device' .. deviceId .. '/quality/inspector', inspector)
emit('./Device' .. deviceId .. '/quality/partNumber', partNumber)
local passed = result_status == 'PASS' or defectCount == 0
return deviceId .. '/' .. inspectionId .. ': ' .. (passed and 'PASS' or 'FAIL')

examples.name: tcpAsciiDevice1
examples.init_script:
-- Initialize TCP ASCII communication
print('TCP ASCII connector initialized')
-- Import string manipulation libraries
stringx = require('pl.stringx')
-- Define response cleaning functions
function cleanResponse(response)
  if not response then return '' end
  -- Remove common response markers and whitespace
  response = stringx.replace(response, '>', '')
  response = stringx.replace(response, '<', '')
  response = stringx.replace(response, '\r\n', '')
  response = stringx.replace(response, '\n', '')
  response = stringx.replace(response, '\r', '')
  response = stringx.strip(response)
  return response
end
function parseCSVResponse(response)
  if not response or response == '' then return {} end
  local cleanResp = cleanResponse(response)
  return stringx.split(cleanResp, ',')
end
function extractNumericValue(response, position)
  local parts = parseCSVResponse(response)
  if #parts >= (position or 2) then
    return tonumber(stringx.strip(parts[position or 2]))
  else
    return nil
  end
end
function validateNumeric(value, min, max)
  return value and value >= (min or -math.huge) and value <= (max or math.huge)
end
examples.enter_script:
-- Log TCP communication cycle
-- print('Starting TCP ASCII command cycle')
examples.exit_script:
-- Calculate machine utilization from collected data
local execution = cache('./Execution', 'IDLE')
local alarmCount = cache('./AlarmCount', 0)
local spindleLoad = cache('./SpindleLoad', 0)
local currentTime = os.time()
local lastTime = cache('last_util_time', currentTime)
local runTime = cache('total_run_time', 0)
-- Update run time if machine is executing
if execution == 'ACTIVE' and currentTime > lastTime then
  runTime = runTime + (currentTime - lastTime)
  set('total_run_time', runTime)
end
set('last_util_time', currentTime)
-- Calculate utilization percentage over last hour
local utilization = (runTime / 3600) * 100
if utilization <= 100 then
  emit('./MachineUtilization', math.floor(utilization * 10) / 10)
end
-- Calculate machine health score
local healthScore = 100
if alarmCount > 0 then healthScore = healthScore - (alarmCount * 10) end
if spindleLoad > 90 then healthScore = healthScore - 20 end
if execution == 'FAULT' then healthScore = healthScore - 50 end
emit('./MachineHealthScore', math.max(0, healthScore))

items.name: SystemAvailability
items.script:
-- Calculate system availability
local isConnected = cache('./$SYSTEM/IsConnected', false)
local execution = cache('./Execution', 'UNAVAILABLE')
local alarmCount = cache('./AlarmCount', 0)
if not isConnected then
  return 'Unavailable'
elseif alarmCount > 0 then
  return 'Fault'
elseif execution == 'ACTIVE' then
  return 'Available'
else
  return 'Idle'
end

items.name: SerialNumber
items.script:
-- Get machine serial number (Haas Q100 command)
local cleanResp = cleanResponse(result)
local value = extractNumericValue(cleanResp, 2)
if value then
  return tostring(value)
else
  return cleanResp
end

items.name: PartCount
items.script:
-- Get total part count (Haas Q300 command)
local value = extractNumericValue(result, 2)
if value and validateNumeric(value, 0, 999999) then
  return math.floor(value)
else
  return cache('./PartCount', 0)
end

items.name: Execution
items.script:
-- Get execution status (Haas Q500 command)
local parts = parseCSVResponse(result)
if #parts >= 3 then
  local status = stringx.strip(parts[3])
  local statusMap = {
    ['0'] = 'IDLE',
    ['1'] = 'ACTIVE',
    ['2'] = 'INTERRUPTED',
    ['3'] = 'FEED_HOLD',
    ['4'] = 'STOPPED'
  }
  return statusMap[status] or status
else
  return 'UNAVAILABLE'
end

examples.name: udpDataServer
examples.init_script:
-- Initialize UDP Server data processing
print('UDP Server connector initialized on port 2323')
-- Import required libraries
struct = require('struct')
json = require('json')
stringx = require('pl.stringx')
-- Define protocol identifiers
PROTOCOL_SENSOR_DATA = 0x01
PROTOCOL_ALARM_DATA = 0x02
PROTOCOL_STATUS_DATA = 0x03
PROTOCOL_PRODUCTION_DATA = 0x04
PROTOCOL_TEXT_MESSAGE = 0x05
-- Data validation functions
function validateTemperature(temp)
  return temp and temp >= -50 and temp <= 200
end
function validatePressure(pressure)
  return pressure and pressure >= 0 and pressure <= 1000
end
function bytesToHex(bytes)
  local hex = ''
  for i = 1, #bytes do
    hex = hex .. string.format('%02X ', bytes[i])
  end
  return hex:sub(1, -2)
end
function bytesToString(bytes)
  local str = ''
  for i = 1, #bytes do
    if bytes[i] > 0 and bytes[i] < 127 then
      str = str .. string.char(bytes[i])
    end
  end
  return str
end
examples.enter_script:
-- Log UDP message processing cycle
-- print('UDP Server processing cycle started')
examples.exit_script:
-- Calculate UDP traffic statistics
local messagesReceived = cache('total_messages', 0)
local bytesReceived = cache('total_bytes', 0)
local currentTime = os.time()
local lastTime = cache('last_stats_time', currentTime)
if currentTime > lastTime then
  local deltaTime = currentTime - lastTime
  local messagesPerSecond = deltaTime > 0 and (messagesReceived / deltaTime) or 0
  local bytesPerSecond = deltaTime > 0 and (bytesReceived / deltaTime) or 0
  emit('./UDPStats/messagesPerSecond', math.floor(messagesPerSecond * 10) / 10)
  emit('./UDPStats/bytesPerSecond', math.floor(bytesPerSecond))
  emit('./UDPStats/totalMessages', messagesReceived)
  emit('./UDPStats/totalBytes', bytesReceived)
end

items.name: RawMessageData
items.script:
-- Process raw UDP message data
if not result or #result == 0 then return nil end
-- Update statistics
local totalMessages = cache('total_messages', 0) + 1
local totalBytes = cache('total_bytes', 0) + #result
set('total_messages', totalMessages)
set('total_bytes', totalBytes)
-- Convert to hex string for debugging
local hexData = bytesToHex(result)
local messageLength = #result
-- Emit raw data details
emit('./RawMessageData/length', messageLength)
emit('./RawMessageData/hex', hexData)
-- Try to determine protocol type from first byte
if messageLength > 0 then
  local protocolType = result[1]
  emit('./RawMessageData/protocolType', protocolType)
  return 'Protocol: ' .. protocolType .. ', Length: ' .. messageLength
else
  return 'Empty message'
end

items.name: SensorDataProtocol
items.script:
-- Process sensor data protocol (Type 0x01)
if not result or #result < 13 then return nil end
-- Check if this is sensor data protocol
if result[1] ~= PROTOCOL_SENSOR_DATA then return nil end
-- Parse binary sensor data packet
-- Format: [Protocol][SensorID][Temperature][Pressure][Humidity][Timestamp]
--         1 byte   4 bytes    4 bytes      4 bytes    2 bytes   4 bytes
local sensorId = struct.unpack('<I', string.char(result[2], result[3], result[4], result[5]))
local temperature = struct.unpack('<f', string.char(result[6], result[7], result[8], result[9]))
local pressure = struct.unpack('<f', string.char(result[10], result[11], result[12], result[13]))
local humidity = 0
local timestamp = os.time()
if #result >= 15 then
  humidity = struct.unpack('<H', string.char(result[14], result[15]))
end
if #result >= 19 then
  timestamp = struct.unpack('<I', string.char(result[16], result[17], result[18], result[19]))
end
-- Validate sensor data
if not validateTemperature(temperature) then return nil end
if not validatePressure(pressure) then return nil end
-- Emit individual sensor readings
emit('./SensorDataProtocol/sensor' .. sensorId .. '/temperature', math.floor(temperature * 10) / 10)
emit('./SensorDataProtocol/sensor' .. sensorId .. '/pressure', math.floor(pressure * 10) / 10)
emit('./SensorDataProtocol/sensor' .. sensorId .. '/humidity', humidity)
emit('./SensorDataProtocol/sensor' .. sensorId .. '/timestamp', timestamp)
return 'Sensor ' .. sensorId .. ': T=' .. math.floor(temperature) .. 'C, P=' .. math.floor(pressure) .. ' PSI'

items.name: AlarmDataProtocol
items.script:
-- Process alarm data protocol (Type 0x02)
if not result or #result < 10 then return nil end
-- Check if this is alarm data protocol
if result[1] ~= PROTOCOL_ALARM_DATA then return nil end
-- Parse alarm packet
-- Format: [Protocol][DeviceID][AlarmCode][Severity][Timestamp]
--         1 byte    4 bytes   2 bytes     1 byte   4 bytes
local deviceId = struct.unpack('<I', string.char(result[2], result[3], result[4], result[5]))
local alarmCode = struct.unpack('<H', string.char(result[6], result[7]))
local severity = result[8]
local timestamp = os.time()
if #result >= 12 then
  timestamp = struct.unpack('<I', string.char(result[9], result[10], result[11], result[12]))
end
-- Map severity levels
local severityMap = {
  [1] = 'INFO',
  [2] = 'WARNING',
  [3] = 'ERROR',
  [4] = 'CRITICAL'
}
local severityText = severityMap[severity] or 'UNKNOWN'
-- Map common alarm codes
local alarmMap = {
  [100] = 'Temperature_High',
  [101] = 'Pressure_Low',
  [102] = 'Communication_Error',
  [103] = 'Power_Supply_Fault',
  [104] = 'Safety_Circuit_Open',
  [105] = 'Motor_Overload'
}
local alarmText = alarmMap[alarmCode] or ('Alarm_' .. alarmCode)
-- Emit alarm details
emit('./AlarmDataProtocol/device' .. deviceId .. '/alarmCode', alarmCode)
emit('./AlarmDataProtocol/device' .. deviceId .. '/severity', severityText)
emit('./AlarmDataProtocol/device' .. deviceId .. '/alarmText', alarmText)
emit('./AlarmDataProtocol/device' .. deviceId .. '/timestamp', timestamp)
return '[' .. severityText .. '] Device ' .. deviceId .. ': ' .. alarmText

items.name: StatusDataProtocol
items.script:
-- Process status data protocol (Type 0x03)
if not result or #result < 9 then return nil end
-- Check if this is status data protocol
if result[1] ~= PROTOCOL_STATUS_DATA then return nil end
-- Parse status packet
-- Format: [Protocol][DeviceID][Status][OperatingHours][Timestamp]
--         1 byte    4 bytes   1 byte  2 bytes        4 bytes (optional)
local deviceId = struct.unpack('<I', string.char(result[2], result[3], result[4], result[5]))
local status = result[6]
local operatingHours = struct.unpack('<H', string.char(result[7], result[8]))
local timestamp = os.time()
if #result >= 12 then
  timestamp = struct.unpack('<I', string.char(result[9], result[10], result[11], result[12]))
end
-- Map status codes
local statusMap = {
  [0] = 'Offline',
  [1] = 'Online',
  [2] = 'Running',
  [3] = 'Stopped',
  [4] = 'Maintenance',
  [5] = 'Fault'
}
local statusText = statusMap[status] or 'Unknown'
-- Emit status information
emit('./StatusDataProtocol/device' .. deviceId .. '/status', statusText)
emit('./StatusDataProtocol/device' .. deviceId .. '/operatingHours', operatingHours)
emit('./StatusDataProtocol/device' .. deviceId .. '/timestamp', timestamp)
return 'Device ' .. deviceId .. ': ' .. statusText .. ' (' .. operatingHours .. 'h)'

items.name: ProductionDataProtocol
items.script:
-- Process production data protocol (Type 0x04)
if not result or #result < 15 then return nil end
-- Check if this is production data protocol
if result[1] ~= PROTOCOL_PRODUCTION_DATA then return nil end
-- Parse production packet
-- Format: [Protocol][LineID][PartCount][GoodParts][RejectParts][CycleTime]
--         1 byte    4 bytes  4 bytes    4 bytes    4 bytes      2 bytes
local lineId = struct.unpack('<I', string.char(result[2], result[3], result[4], result[5]))
local partCount = struct.unpack('<I', string.char(result[6], result[7], result[8], result[9]))
local goodParts = struct.unpack('<I', string.char(result[10], result[11], result[12], result[13]))
local rejectParts = struct.unpack('<I', string.char(result[14], result[15], result[16], result[17]))
local cycleTime = 0
if #result >= 19 then
  cycleTime = struct.unpack('<H', string.char(result[18], result[19]))
end
-- Calculate quality metrics
local qualityRate = partCount > 0 and (goodParts / partCount * 100) or 100
local rejectRate = partCount > 0 and (rejectParts / partCount * 100) or 0
-- Emit production data
emit('./ProductionDataProtocol/line' .. lineId .. '/partCount', partCount)
emit('./ProductionDataProtocol/line' .. lineId .. '/goodParts', goodParts)
emit('./ProductionDataProtocol/line' .. lineId .. '/rejectParts', rejectParts)
emit('./ProductionDataProtocol/line' .. lineId .. '/cycleTime', cycleTime)
emit('./ProductionDataProtocol/line' .. lineId .. '/qualityRate', math.floor(qualityRate * 10) / 10)
emit('./ProductionDataProtocol/line' .. lineId .. '/rejectRate', math.floor(rejectRate * 10) / 10)
return 'Line ' .. lineId .. ': ' .. partCount .. ' parts, Quality: ' .. math.floor(qualityRate) .. '%'

items.name: TextMessageProtocol
items.script:
-- Process text message protocol (Type 0x05)
if not result or #result < 2 then return nil end
-- Check if this is text message protocol
if result[1] ~= PROTOCOL_TEXT_MESSAGE then return nil end
-- Extract text message (remaining bytes after protocol identifier)
local textBytes = {}
for i = 2, #result do
  table.insert(textBytes, result[i])
end
local textMessage = bytesToString(textBytes)
-- Clean up text message
textMessage = string.gsub(textMessage, '^%s*(.-)%s*$', '%1')
if textMessage == '' then return nil end
-- Try to parse as JSON if it looks like JSON
if string.sub(textMessage, 1, 1) == '{' then
  local success, data = pcall(json.decode, textMessage)
  if success and data then
    -- Process JSON message
    local messageType = data.type or 'unknown'
    local source = data.source or 'unknown'
    local content = data.message or data.content or textMessage
    emit('./TextMessageProtocol/json/' .. messageType, content)
    emit('./TextMessageProtocol/json/source', source)
    return '[JSON] ' .. messageType .. ' from ' .. source
  end
end
-- Process as plain text
emit('./TextMessageProtocol/text/message', textMessage)
return '[TEXT] ' .. textMessage

items.name: CSVDataFormat
items.script:
-- Process CSV format data over UDP
if not result or #result < 10 then return nil end
-- Convert bytes to string
local csvData = bytesToString(result)
if csvData == '' then return nil end
-- Check if it looks like CSV (contains commas)
if not string.find(csvData, ',') then return nil end
-- Parse CSV data
local fields = stringx.split(csvData, ',')
if #fields < 3 then return nil end
-- Extract common CSV format: DeviceID,Timestamp,Value1,Value2,Value3...
local deviceId = stringx.strip(fields[1])
local timestamp = tonumber(stringx.strip(fields[2])) or os.time()
local values = {}
for i = 3, #fields do
  local value = tonumber(stringx.strip(fields[i]))
  if value then
    table.insert(values, value)
    emit('./CSVDataFormat/' .. deviceId .. '/value' .. (i-2), value)
  end
end
emit('./CSVDataFormat/' .. deviceId .. '/timestamp', timestamp)
return deviceId .. ': ' .. #values .. ' values received'

items.name: ModbusUDPSimulation
items.script:
-- Simulate Modbus-like protocol over UDP
if not result or #result < 8 then return nil end
-- Simple Modbus-like packet: [SlaveID][Function][StartAddr][NumRegs][Data...]
local slaveId = result[1]
local functionCode = result[2]
local startAddr = struct.unpack('<H', string.char(result[3], result[4]))
local numRegs = struct.unpack('<H', string.char(result[5], result[6]))
-- Only process read holding registers response (function 3)
if functionCode ~= 3 or #result < 7 + (numRegs * 2) then return nil end
local byteCount = result[7]
if byteCount ~= (numRegs * 2) then return nil end
-- Extract register values
local registers = {}
for i = 1, numRegs do
  local regOffset = 8 + ((i-1) * 2)
  if regOffset + 1 <= #result then
    local regValue = struct.unpack('<H', string.char(result[regOffset], result[regOffset + 1]))
    table.insert(registers, regValue)
    emit('./ModbusUDPSimulation/slave' .. slaveId .. '/register' .. (startAddr + i - 1), regValue)
  end
end
return 'Slave ' .. slaveId .. ': ' .. numRegs .. ' registers from address ' .. startAddr

items.name: HeartbeatMessages
items.script:
-- Process simple heartbeat messages
if not result or #result < 5 then return nil end
-- Simple heartbeat: 'ALIVE' or 'PING'
local message = bytesToString(result)
if message == 'ALIVE' or message == 'PING' then
  local currentTime = os.time()
  emit('./HeartbeatMessages/lastHeartbeat', currentTime)
  emit('./HeartbeatMessages/status', 'Online')
  return 'Heartbeat received at ' .. os.date('%H:%M:%S', currentTime)
else
  return nil
end

items.name: BinaryTelemetry
items.script:
-- Process binary telemetry data
if not result or #result < 16 then return nil end
-- Custom telemetry format: [Header][DeviceID][Voltage][Current][Power][Status]
--                          2 bytes  2 bytes   4 bytes  4 bytes  4 bytes 1 byte
local header = struct.unpack('<H', string.char(result[1], result[2]))
if header ~= 0xAABB then return nil end  -- Check for valid header
local deviceId = struct.unpack('<H', string.char(result[3], result[4]))
local voltage = struct.unpack('<f', string.char(result[5], result[6], result[7], result[8]))
local current = struct.unpack('<f', string.char(result[9], result[10], result[11], result[12]))
local power = struct.unpack('<f', string.char(result[13], result[14], result[15], result[16]))
local status = #result >= 17 and result[17] or 0
-- Validate electrical readings
if voltage < 0 or voltage > 600 then return nil end
if current < 0 or current > 500 then return nil end
if power < 0 or power > 300 then return nil end
-- Emit telemetry data
emit('./BinaryTelemetry/device' .. deviceId .. '/voltage', math.floor(voltage * 10) / 10)
emit('./BinaryTelemetry/device' .. deviceId .. '/current', math.floor(current * 100) / 100)
emit('./BinaryTelemetry/device' .. deviceId .. '/power', math.floor(power * 100) / 100)
emit('./BinaryTelemetry/device' .. deviceId .. '/status', status)
return 'Device ' .. deviceId .. ': ' .. math.floor(voltage) .. 'V, ' .. math.floor(current) .. 'A, ' .. math.floor(power) .. 'W'

smartPacSource.description: Reads data from a Wintriss SmartPAC controller

items.description: List of items for the connector

examples.name: smartPacPress1
examples.init_script:
-- Initialize SmartPAC Press monitoring
print('SmartPAC connector initialized')
-- Define press state mappings
PressStates = {
  [0] = 'Stopped',
  [1] = 'Running',
  [2] = 'Maintenance',
  [3] = 'Setup',
  [4] = 'Fault'
}
-- Define die protection status
DieStates = {
  [0] = 'OK',
  [1] = 'Misfeed',
  [2] = 'Part_Stuck',
  [3] = 'Double_Feed',
  [4] = 'No_Part'
}
-- Force conversion factor (assuming force in tons)
LBS_PER_TON = 2000
-- Initialize counters
totalStrokes = 0
goodParts = 0
rejectParts = 0
examples.enter_script:
-- Log press monitoring cycle
-- print('SmartPAC data collection cycle started')
examples.exit_script:
-- Calculate press efficiency metrics
local currentStrokes = cache('./StrokeCount', 0)
local currentGood = cache('./GoodPartCount', 0)
local currentRejects = cache('./RejectCount', 0)
local isRunning = cache('./PressRunning', false)
-- Calculate efficiency
local totalParts = currentGood + currentRejects
local efficiency = totalParts > 0 and (currentGood / totalParts * 100) or 100
local strokesPerMinute = 0
local currentTime = os.time()
local lastTime = cache('last_efficiency_time', currentTime)
if currentTime > lastTime then
  local deltaTime = (currentTime - lastTime) / 60  -- Convert to minutes
  local lastStrokes = cache('last_stroke_count', 0)
  strokesPerMinute = deltaTime > 0 and ((currentStrokes - lastStrokes) / deltaTime) or 0
end
set('last_efficiency_time', currentTime)
set('last_stroke_count', currentStrokes)
-- Emit calculated metrics
emit('./PressEfficiency', math.floor(efficiency * 10) / 10)
emit('./StrokesPerMinute', math.floor(strokesPerMinute * 10) / 10)
local utilizationPercent = isRunning and 100 or 0
emit('./Utilization', utilizationPercent)

items.name: SystemAvailability
items.script:
-- Calculate press availability
local isConnected = cache('./$SYSTEM/IsConnected', false)
local pressRunning = cache('./PressRunning', false)
local hasFault = cache('./FaultActive', false)
local safetyOK = cache('./SafetyStatus', true)
if not isConnected then
  return 'Unavailable'
elseif hasFault or not safetyOK then
  return 'Fault'
elseif pressRunning then
  return 'Available'
else
  return 'Stopped'
end

items.name: PressType
items.script:
-- Press type identification
if not result or #result < 1 then return 'Unknown' end
local pressType = tostring(result[1] or 'Unknown')
local typeMap = {
  ['1'] = 'Mechanical',
  ['2'] = 'Hydraulic',
  ['3'] = 'Servo',
  ['4'] = 'Pneumatic'
}
return typeMap[pressType] or pressType

items.name: PressName
items.script:
-- Press identification name
if not result or #result < 2 then return 'Unknown' end
local pressName = tostring(result[2] or 'Unknown')
pressName = string.gsub(pressName, '^%s*(.-)%s*$', '%1')
return pressName ~= '' and pressName or 'Unnamed_Press'

items.name: PressRunning
items.script:
-- Press running status
if not result or #result < 3 then return false end
local running = result[3] == 1 or result[3] == true
return running

xmlWebScraperSource.description: Reads data from an XML web page

items.description: List of items for the connector

examples.name: xmlDataScraper
examples.init_script:
-- Initialize XML Web Scraper
print('XML Web Scraper connector initialized')
-- Import additional libraries
stringx = require('pl.stringx')
-- Define data validation functions
function validateNumeric(value, min, max)
  local num = tonumber(value)
  return num and num >= (min or -math.huge) and num <= (max or math.huge) and num or nil
end
function cleanText(text)
  if not text then return 'Unknown' end
  text = string.gsub(text, '^%s*(.-)%s*$', '%1')
  return text ~= '' and text or 'Unknown'
end
function parseTimestamp(timeStr)
  if not timeStr then return os.time() end
  -- Simple timestamp parsing - could be enhanced
  return timeStr
end
examples.enter_script:
-- Log XML scraping cycle
-- print('Starting XML data scraping cycle')
examples.exit_script:
-- Calculate overall system health from scraped data
local connectedSystems = 0
local totalSystems = 5
local avgTemp = 0
local tempCount = 0
-- Check system connections
for i = 1, totalSystems do
  if cache('./System' .. i .. '/status', 'offline') == 'online' then
    connectedSystems = connectedSystems + 1
  end
  local temp = cache('./System' .. i .. '/temperature', nil)
  if temp then
    avgTemp = avgTemp + temp
    tempCount = tempCount + 1
  end
end
if tempCount > 0 then
  avgTemp = avgTemp / tempCount
end
local systemHealth = (connectedSystems / totalSystems) * 100
emit('./SystemHealth/connectedSystems', connectedSystems)
emit('./SystemHealth/healthPercentage', math.floor(systemHealth))
emit('./SystemHealth/averageTemperature', math.floor(avgTemp * 10) / 10)
examples.item_script:
-- Default processing for XML elements
local elementText = result and result.InnerText or ''
-- Clean and validate the text content
local cleanedText = cleanText(elementText)
return cleanedText

items.name: DeviceAvailability
items.script:
-- Extract MTConnect device availability
if not result then return nil end

if timestamp then
  emit('./DeviceAvailability/timestamp', timestamp)
end
return string.upper(availability)

items.name: SpindleSpeed

if timestamp then
  emit('./SpindleSpeed/timestamp', timestamp)

items.name: Execution

end
-- Map execution states

  ['INTERRUPTED'] = 'Interrupted',

  ['STOPPED'] = 'Stopped'

items.name: ControllerMode

  ['SEMI_AUTOMATIC'] = 'Semi_Automatic',
  ['MDI'] = 'Manual_Data_Input'
}

items.name: ActiveProgram
items.script:
-- Extract active program name
if not result then return nil end

local timestamp = result:GetAttribute('timestamp')
if timestamp then
  emit('./ActiveProgram/timestamp', timestamp)
end

items.name: PartCount

local timestamp = result:GetAttribute('timestamp')
if timestamp then

end

items.name: XAxisPosition

local units = result:GetAttribute('units') or 'MILLIMETER'

items.name: YAxisPosition

items.name: ZAxisPosition

items.name: ToolNumber

items.name: FeedRate

items.name: SpindleLoad

items.name: SystemAlarms
items.script:
-- Extract system alarms and conditions
if not result then return nil end
local level = result:GetAttribute('level') or 'NORMAL'
local type = result:GetAttribute('type') or 'SYSTEM'
local dataItemId = result:GetAttribute('dataItemId') or 'unknown'
local nativeCode = result:GetAttribute('nativeCode') or ''
local text = cleanText(result.InnerText)
local timestamp = result:GetAttribute('timestamp')
-- Emit alarm details
emit('./SystemAlarms/' .. dataItemId .. '/level', level)
emit('./SystemAlarms/' .. dataItemId .. '/type', type)
emit('./SystemAlarms/' .. dataItemId .. '/nativeCode', nativeCode)
emit('./SystemAlarms/' .. dataItemId .. '/text', text)
if timestamp then
  emit('./SystemAlarms/' .. dataItemId .. '/timestamp', timestamp)
end
return '[' .. level .. '] ' .. type .. ': ' .. text

items.name: DeviceInformation
items.script:
-- Extract device UUID
if not result then return nil end
local uuid = tostring(result)
return uuid ~= '' and uuid or 'Unknown'

items.name: DataItemCount
items.script:
-- Count total data items in response
local count = tonumber(result)
return count or 0

items.name: LastUpdateSequence
items.script:
-- Extract last sequence number
local sequence = tonumber(result)
return sequence or 0

items.name: PowerConsumption
items.script:
-- Extract power consumption
if not result then return nil end
local power = validateNumeric(result.InnerText, 0, 100)
local units = result:GetAttribute('units') or 'KILOWATT'
if units then
  emit('./PowerConsumption/units', units)
end
return power and (math.floor(power * 100) / 100) or 0

items.name: Temperature
items.script:
-- Extract temperature reading
if not result then return nil end
local temp = validateNumeric(result.InnerText, -50, 200)
local units = result:GetAttribute('units') or 'CELSIUS'
if units then
  emit('./Temperature/units', units)
end
return temp and (math.floor(temp * 10) / 10) or nil

items.name: CycleTime
items.script:
-- Extract cycle time
if not result then return nil end
local cycleTime = validateNumeric(result.InnerText, 0, 3600)
local units = result:GetAttribute('units') or 'SECOND'
if units then
  emit('./CycleTime/units', units)
end
return cycleTime and (math.floor(cycleTime * 100) / 100) or 0

items.name: WorkpieceCounter
items.script:
-- Extract workpiece counter
if not result then return nil end
local workpiece = result.InnerText or ''
local parts = string.match(workpiece, 'count:(%d+)')
if parts then
  return tonumber(parts)
else
  return validateNumeric(workpiece, 0, 999999) or 0
end

items.name: ToolLife
items.script:
-- Extract tool life information
if not result then return nil end
local toolLife = result.InnerText or ''
-- Try to extract percentage from tool life string
local percentage = string.match(toolLife, '(%d+)%%')
if percentage then
  return tonumber(percentage)
else
  -- Try to extract remaining count
  local remaining = string.match(toolLife, 'remaining:(%d+)')
  if remaining then
    emit('./ToolLife/remaining', tonumber(remaining))
    return 'Remaining: ' .. remaining
  else
    return cleanText(toolLife)
  end
end

items.name: SystemStatus
items.script:
-- Extract system instance ID for health monitoring
local instanceId = tonumber(result)
if instanceId then
  -- Store for system health calculation
  emit('./SystemStatus/instanceId', instanceId)
  return 'Instance: ' .. instanceId
else
  return 'Unknown Instance'
end

-- Initialize Yaskawa Robot monitoring
print('Yaskawa Robot connector initialized')
-- Define robot status mappings
RobotStates = {
  [0] = 'Stopped',
  [1] = 'Running',
  [2] = 'Paused',
  [3] = 'Error',
  [4] = 'Teaching',
  [5] = 'Play'
}
-- Define alarm severity mappings
AlarmSeverity = {
  [1] = 'Information',
  [2] = 'Warning',
  [3] = 'Minor',
  [4] = 'Major',
  [5] = 'Critical'
}
-- Position conversion factors
MM_TO_INCHES = 0.0393701
DEG_TO_RAD = math.pi / 180
examples.enter_script:
-- Log robot monitoring cycle
-- print('Robot data collection cycle started')
examples.exit_script:
-- Calculate robot utilization and efficiency
local isRunning = cache('./RobotRunning', false)
local isInCycle = cache('./InCycle', false)
local currentTime = os.time()
local lastTime = cache('last_util_time', currentTime)
local runTime = cache('total_run_time', 0)
local cycleTime = cache('total_cycle_time', 0)
-- Update run time
if isRunning and currentTime > lastTime then
  local deltaTime = currentTime - lastTime
  runTime = runTime + deltaTime
  set('total_run_time', runTime)
  if isInCycle then
    cycleTime = cycleTime + deltaTime
    set('total_cycle_time', cycleTime)
  end
end
set('last_util_time', currentTime)
-- Calculate utilization over last hour
local utilization = (runTime / 3600) * 100
local cycleEfficiency = runTime > 0 and (cycleTime / runTime * 100) or 0
if utilization <= 100 then
  emit('./Utilization', math.floor(utilization * 10) / 10)
end
if cycleEfficiency <= 100 then
  emit('./CycleEfficiency', math.floor(cycleEfficiency * 10) / 10)
end

items.name: CartesianRotationRz

items.script:

return running

items.name: CurrentStep
items.script:
-- Current program step
local step = tonumber(result)
if step and step >= 0 and step <= 9999 then
  return step
else
  return 0
end

items.name: JobName
items.script:
-- Current job/program name
local jobName = tostring(result or '')
jobName = string.gsub(jobName, '^%s*(.-)%s*$', '%1')
return jobName ~= '' and jobName or 'No_Job'

items.name: JobLine
items.script:
-- Current job line number

if line and line >= 0 then
  return line
else
  return 0
end

items.name: JobStep

items.name: SpeedOverride
items.script:
-- Speed override percentage

  return override
else

end

items.name: AlarmCode

items.name: AlarmData
items.script:

return data or 0

items.name: AlarmType
items.script:
-- Alarm type/category
local alarmType = tonumber(result)
local types = {
  [1] = 'System',
  [2] = 'User',
  [3] = 'Motion',
  [4] = 'I/O',
  [5] = 'Safety'
}
return types[alarmType] or 'Unknown'

items.name: AlarmText
items.script:
-- Alarm text message
local text = tostring(result or '')
text = string.gsub(text, '^%s*(.-)%s*$', '%1')
return text ~= '' and text or 'No_Message'

items.name: AlarmOccurringTime
items.script:
-- Alarm occurrence timestamp
local timestamp = tonumber(result)
if timestamp and timestamp > 0 then
  return os.date('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S', timestamp)
else
  return 'No_Time'
end

items.name: CycleCount
items.script:
-- Calculate cycle count based on job completion
local currentStep = cache('./CurrentStep', 0)
local lastStep = cache('last_step', 0)
local cycleCount = cache('cycle_count', 0)
-- Detect cycle completion (step reset to 1 or low value)
if lastStep > 10 and currentStep <= 3 then
  cycleCount = cycleCount + 1
  set('cycle_count', cycleCount)
end
set('last_step', currentStep)
return cycleCount

items.name: OverallEffectiveness
items.script:
-- Calculate overall robot effectiveness
local isRunning = cache('./RobotRunning', false)
local hasAlarm = cache('./AlarmActive', false)
local servoOn = cache('./ServoOn', false)
local inCycle = cache('./InCycle', false)
-- Calculate availability (0-100)
local availability = 0
if servoOn and not hasAlarm then
  availability = 100
end
-- Calculate performance (0-100)
local performance = 0
if isRunning and inCycle then
  performance = 100
elseif isRunning then
  performance = 50
end
-- Calculate quality (assume 100% unless errors)
local quality = hasAlarm and 50 or 100
-- Overall effectiveness
local oee = (availability * performance * quality) / 1000000 * 100
return math.floor(oee * 10) / 10
